repnme.cdata!:
Argentina - Water Supply and Sewerage
            Sector Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The project outcomes are considered
            satisfactory. Project sustainability is rated likely.
            Overall World Bank performance is rated marginally
            satisfactory, despite less-than-satisfactory performance
            during preparation and early years of supervision. The Bank
            responded well to the changing Government priorities, and in
            the end, achieved the project objectives with less
            financing. Similarly, overall Borrower performance is rated
            marginally satisfactory. Although Borrower performance in
            the last years of project implementation improved, the
            frequent political interference and inexperienced executing
            agency during the project preparation stage and in the
            earlier stage of project implementation made it difficult
            for the project to be implemented smoothly. Lessons learned
            pointed to problems with project design, specifically
            sub-project identification and selection, and sub-loan
            allocation and reallocation mechanisms; project
            implementation problems such as local government
            interference with the procurement process, the privatization
            processes' interference with collecting and following
            monitoring indicators, and the failure of the transfer of
            knowledge and know-how from the qualified and effective team
            of consultants to the permanent staff; and sector policy
            problems like ineffective institutional strengthening
            programs for public utilities. Other lessons concerned
            private sector participation (PSP) and included the need for
            the government's political commitment to regulatory refor

repnme.cdata!:
Argentina - Water Supply and Sewerage
            Sector Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The project objectives are to: (a)
            promote greater sector efficiency and financial viability;
            (b) expand service coverage; (c) improve the quality of the
            water supply and sewerage services while protecting the
            environment; and (d) encourage private sector participation
            in the water and sanitation sector. Investments eligible for
            financing under the project consist of those required to:
            (a) improve the operations of water utilities; (b)
            rehabilitate water and sewerage system; (c) expand water and
            sewerage system; (d) prepare studies and design; and (e)
            improve the Federal Council for Potable Water and
            Sanitation's operations.

docna.cdata!: Argentina - Water Supply and Sewerage Sector Project
